summary: Former Kamlaris (indentured girl child labourers) living at a hostel run by Surya Binayak Secondary School, at Sonpur VDC in Dang district, have not had a proper meal for the past one month. After the school headmaster, Krishna Kumar, refused to furnish the school’s expense details, the chairman of school management committee, Puran Chaudhary, has           stopped signing cheques for the school. Netra Prasad Pokhrel, former chairman of the school management committee, said the row between Krishna Kumar and Puran has affected the entire school activities. The government allocates Rs 3,000 (Rs 2,500 for food and Rs 500 as pocket money) per month to each student living in the hostel that houses 103 former Kamlari girls.
title: ex-kamlari-girls-go-hungry-as-school-lands-in-financial-row
